result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Dean Louis

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
8:30 AM Defendant Joshua Dean Louis in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Joshua Dean Louis.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date. DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint. Atty Thomas-Schmidt waives time limits of preliminary hearing. Court sets preliminary hearing. Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 11:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 4, 2023 at 11:45 am.

11:38 AM Defendant Joshua Dean Louis appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Gabriel Pollak (Special Appearance) appeared by video for Joshua Dean Louis.  Attorney Jennifer Gross appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court reviews court record.  Attny Pollak makes statement as to missed appearance.   State request reinstate bond.   Court reinstate bond CBS $500, and  discusses importance of bond conditions with DEF.    Attny Pollak request set initial appearance for DEF to appear with attorney.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Uploaded warrant document to ShareFile and sent paper copy to Sheriff's Department.  No warrant card generated.

9:16 AM  Defendant Joshua Dean Louis not in court.  Attorney Alysja Otten (Special Appearance) in court for Joshua Dean Louis.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  State requests warrant and bail forfeiture proceedings.   Court grants request.  Warrant authorized (Wisconsin and Surrounding States) as requested and bail forfeiture to begin.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Joshua Dean Louis   CASE:  L22-1904

OWI 5th or 6th Offense
Bail/bond hearing on August 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:13 AM DE Joshua Dean Louis in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Alysja Otten  (special appearance). Jennifer Gross appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   DE does not qualify for public defender.  Court questions PC Statement,  State responds.  Court finds probable cause and signs document.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Otten argues bond.  Court sets bond.   Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for September 20, 2022 at 8:30AM.  

CBS $500  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
